alert.note: Alert for Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 11:58PM EDT until July 11 at 8:20AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... White River At West Hartford affecting Windsor County. For the White River...including West Hartford...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at West Hartford. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Route 14 west of West Hartford will be flooded, and there will be widespread field flooding in the White River valley. At 19.0 feet, Floodwaters will approach homes and businesses near the river, and Route 14 will be inundated. There will be widespread flooding of fields and lowlands through the White River Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EDT Monday was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.8 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on 01/25/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EDT.
